intro: Platystele densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered platystele, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is a small, terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, humid environments with high moisture levels. The plant has a short, underground rhizome and produces delicate, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its unique morphology and habitat requirements make it highly sensitive to environmental changes. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological needs, Platystele densiflora is considered an endangered species.
